session_synopses.AD_Patroller001Witness: DockPatroller_001 witness DockJumper jump into the water.
session_synopses.AD_ObserverFishing: The Dock Guard Observer is standing peering over the dock where one of his subordinates just jumped into the water for apparently no reason. All lines are low grumbling, as if spoken to the dead man.

DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated.text: It won't work - not until we find out what is keeping him from death!

session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first

AD_WelcomingMinthara.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_WelcomingMinthara.text: Nightwarden Minthara - your dereliction of duty has finally caught up with you.
AD_WelcomingMinthara.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_FailedInterrogation.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_FailedInterrogation.text: Break them, before they call for help.
AD_FailedInterrogation.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_AttackedTorturers.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_AttackedTorturers.text: You dared scar my mind, I will gut you.
AD_AttackedTorturers.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: You were adored, Minthara. Brought up from the darkness, and into the Absolute's light.
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over Minthara, speaking serenely and calmly, like a priest giving the last rites, in horrible contrast to the words she's saying

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: She cherished you. But it wasn't enough - you were distracted by your own desires.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: And most damning of all, an inability to follow orders.

Torture.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture.text: I obeyed to the best of my ability.
Torture.context: NodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony

Torture.speaker: Narrator
Torture.text: *Minthara's mind connects with yours. Not strong, as you remember it, but fractured... disintegrating.*

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: Come to observe, True Soul? She is a lesson - none can rise so high that they cannot fall again.
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning from Minthara to player, having noticed their approach

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: I expected her to be dismembered. Disappointing.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: When the body suffers, we retreat into the mind. But when the mind breaks, all is lost.

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: This ends now - and so do you.

Torture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture.text: A challenge, sister. Who would be so bold?

Torture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture.text: Offal, sister. Meat that doesn't yet know it is dead.

PAD_HelpMinthara.speaker: Player
PAD_HelpMinthara.text: Minthara was dragged to the prison in Moonrise. If she's still there, this is our last chance to save her.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: Minthara sustains the Absolute's unhealing wound.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: There will be more traitors still. They too must suffer - see to it.

session_synopses.AD_WelcomingMinthara: Minthara has arrived to the torturers room. They are delighted and welcome her before they get to torture her.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The player is accompanied by Minthara and is stopped by the entrance guards. They do not think Minthara should be allowed to leave.
session_synopses.AD_FailedInterrogation: On Minthara's turn, in combat after failing to pass by an interrogating guard.
session_synopses.AD_AttackedTorturers: On Minthara's turn, when attacking the torturers.
session_synopses.Torture: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
session_synopses.PAD_HelpMinthara: When party exits Moonrise after Execution scene, if player have not started helping Minthara in any way we play this PAD to remind about her.
session_synopses.Torturer1: Sumera loves her job and any excuse to cause a little pain. One-liner after torturing Minthara.

AD_Minthara_EnteredNecromancerRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredNecromancerRoom.text: Balthazar's chamber. Digging through the offal is unappealing, but may be worthwhile.

session_synopses.002: The guard standing just inside the entrance of Moonrise Towers. He is here to slightly nudge the player towards the execution room.

AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.text: This chamber is unlike the others here - it does not reek of death.

DaisyAD_Approach.text: We're close. I can feel it - the Absolute. Its power is strong here.

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: That's far enough.
node_data.context: NodeContext: With cool superiority

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His thoughts invade your own, probing for purchase. Your parasite purrs in recognition.*

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: Ah, one blessed like myself. What news, True Soul?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Great news: I'm here to take your head.

node_data.speaker: Zealot Malik
node_data.text: Did you hear that, sister?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Getting ready to fight, so sinister edge.

node_data.speaker: Adept Merim
node_data.text: Did I ever.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to start - should have that edge

AD_Guards.speaker: Zealot Malik
AD_Guards.text: Before the Absolute? I was nobody.

AD_Guard001Greeting.speaker: Zealot Malik
AD_Guard001Greeting.text: You brought Balthazar back from the darkness, I hear. The General will be pleased.
AD_Guard001Greeting.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_Approach: As the player approaches entrance of Moonrise Tower, Daisy warns them they are getting close to the source of the Absolute..
session_synopses.Guard1: Guard who stops you at the entrance to Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.Ghoul2: Trianglehead ghoul at the entrance to Moonrise TowerInclusion will only trigger once on one of the three ghouls (so the inclusion on all three should be the same.)
session_synopses: In this dialogue the player attempts to enter moonrise WITHOUT the drider. The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).
session_synopses.AD_Ghouls: Two ghouls patrol near the entrance of Moonrise. They have beef with the winged ghouls higher up on the exterior of the tower. They (very roughly) talk about their dislike for the winged chouls.
session_synopses.AD_Guards: The two guards at Moonrise entrance kill time wile on duty.
session_synopses.AD_Guard001Greeting: The guard at the entrance of Moonrise welcomes the player when they return (after already been formally greeted).

PAD_ReadWifesNote.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadWifesNote.text: A letter from Ketheric's wife. Sounds like she loved him very much.

session_synopses.PAD_ReadWifesNote: The player found and read the letter written by Melodia, wife of Ketheric (string name: MOO_KethericsChambers_NoteFromWife). It is found in Ketherics room under a loose floor board. Reading this letter opens the option to have Ketheric stand down during the colony fight (he still dies). The VB helps support the notion that this letter is significant.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Flesh! Flank-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Foot-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: SILENCE!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throwing up a hand to silence her comrades to either sideNodeContext: Silencing her comrades, turning to speak to player head-on

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: We hunger, True Soul. The Absolute promised us a feast of corpses, and still we starve!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Just as starving and feral as her companions, but a better grip on herself.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sorry. Fresh out of rotting flesh.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Liar! They drop corpses beneath the tower. Some beast in the tunnels gets fat, while we go hungry!

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: If the Absolute will not share Her dead flesh... we will tear it from the backs of the living.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shifting to a hostile tone, threatening us

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've never eaten ghoul before. For you, I might make an exception.
True

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: You... would not. Could not. I...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Taken aback, wants to stand up to us but genuinely rattled by our threat

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: We will wait, True Soul. But only a little longer. Come!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Last line shouted over shoulder to companions (they fly away immediately after dialogue)

session_synopses: The player encounters a pack of winged ghouls on Moonrise's upper exterior. They are disgusting undead who are eternally starving for dead and rotting flesh. Though intelligent, they can be near feral in their need to feed.In this case, the player meets a still-intelligent one with two less-bright comrades. The leader challenges the player, saying the cult has promised them plenty of meat but they've received none. Instead, the corpses are dropped below the tower (unbeknownst to them, to be fed to the Elder Brain or used in the Necromancer's experiments)

AD_Gnoll01.speaker: 'Barnabus'
AD_Gnoll01.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [REUSE] GNOLL_Rig_SCENE_PLA_ConflictedFlind_Cackle_01
GNOLL_M_NKD_Head_A_Rig_SCENE_PLA_ConflictedFlind_Cackle_01

This cackle might not fit the chitter, and so might not need a custom anim.

session_synopses.AD_Gnoll01: A gnoll in the kitchen of Moonrise Tower

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | I'm not welcome here, but it's safe for now. Thank you. |

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Once we leave this place, I'll make my way to your camp. |

AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.text: Security is tight here. Z'rell made this library her command post.

GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.text: Hey boy - yeh want the bone? Yeh want the bone?
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bends down and picks up a bone, which he waggles at a hyena. The hyena bounces with excitement, ready to play fetch.NodeContext: Bends down and picks up a bone, which he waggles at a hyena.

GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin yeets the bone into the shadows - the hyena turns run after it.NodeContext: Goblin throws the bone into the shadows

GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.text: Argh! Hells - I near stained myself.

GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.text: Just seeing if this shadow curse is as bad as they say. Word is it eats anyone gets too deep into the dark.

GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint.text: I take it you're the True Soul we're waiting on? Needs passage to Moonrise?

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: I wonder what this place looked like in its glory.

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: Still. I bet Ketheric changed his wall hangings as often as his gods.

AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower.text: Careful. The General has excellent hearing, I'm told.

AD_Goblins_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_Goblins_AtTower.text: Wonder if there's dancing down in the war camp. Feelin' frisky.
AD_Goblins_AtTower.context: NodeContext: Despite the playful phrase, makes it sound threatening.

session_synopses.GoblinMelee_001_Checkpoint: The player approaches a goblin camp. Three goblins and a yena are huddled around a campfire, warily watching the shifting shadows. As you step into the light, one of the goblins steps forward to greet you. You can ask him about the shadowy environs, and he will demonstrate the shadow-curse by killing the hyena.
session_synopses.AD_HalfOrcs_AtTower: Half orcs after arriving at Moonrise Towers with the Drider's caravan. Kansif is the solemn leaderm, the other half orc is a relatively new recruit and doesn't guard his tongue too well.
session_synopses.AD_Goblins_AtTower: Goblins relaxing at Moonrise Towers after arriving with the Drider's caravan.

PAD_HideAndSeek.speaker: Player
PAD_HideAndSeek.text: Where'd that child go? Or... whatever it is.
PAD_HideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: Stumped, looking for Oliver Found Oliver (a little shadow/phantom boy they're playing hide and seek with)

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

AD_CreepyNoises.speaker: Oliver
AD_CreepyNoises.text: Someone's coming. Someone new. Maybe they want to play.
AD_CreepyNoises.context: NodeContext: Hushed anticipation. Little giggle at the end.

AD_OliverDeathScream.speaker: Oliver
AD_OliverDeathScream.text: Mummy! Daddy! Betsy! No - don't leave me!

session_synopses.PAD_HideAndSeek: AD played when the player finds or fails to find Oliver during hide & seek.
session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises001: The player hears creepy noises on the path to the house haunted by a shadow family.
session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises: As the player approaches the abandoned house, they hear strange noises from inside, as if someone still lived there.
session_synopses.AD_OliverDeathScream: Death-scream of Oliver in the Oliver's Diary booster.

PAD_FindAnimal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindAnimal.text: The animal never had a chance. The curse consumes everything it touches.

session_synopses.PAD_FindAnimal: The party encounters a dead Shadow Cursed animal and comment on how the Shadow Curse consumes everything

AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.text: *Fallen members of the Emerald Enclave. Casualties in the war against Ketheric Thorm, years past.*

session_synopses.AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen: There are number of pile of fallen withered skeletons in greenish armors of Emerald Enclave.They are remains from the past war with Ketheric and his Justiciars

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I cannot venture back with you - now that I am in a position to fight the curse, I must stay here and see it through.
StayInSCL.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. Halsin doesn't want to backtrack to previous regions while he's close to achieving his goals.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: What if I need you by my side?

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: If you truly need to retread your steps, then you will have little need for me there. You are more formidable than anything that lies in our wake.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I must continue to investigate the curse - this may be my last chance. I shall await your return when you are ready to continue.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Halsin tells the player his business is in SCL now and he will not leave.

000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.text: The lantern's down - we need to get it!

000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDies.text: Got him! Now to get the lantern.

session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDropsLantern: Drider drops lantern (either being disarmed or killed)
session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDies: Drider dies with Harper Lassandra present

PAD_TouchedTorches.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches.text: That's odd. The flame won't go out.

PAD_TouchedTorches.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches.text: Ah - a Continual Flame. There's no dousing fire like this.

session_synopses.PAD_TouchedTorches: Player tries to douse torches in SCL.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text: *Night and shadow have claimed this place. Turn back.*

Mountain.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Mountain.text: Don't stick about. A torch will keep you safe - more or less.

Mountain.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Mountain.text: I'll keep an eye for other True Souls and then head to camp. Can't get out of here fast enough.

PAD_Curse_2Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_2Characters.text: These shadows can pull the life from someone - but not me.

PAD_Curse_2Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_2Characters.text: I feel it, though. My very being, draining out of me.
PAD_Curse_2Characters.context: NodeContext: Affected by the shadow curse, which is draining their strength

PAD_CurseRemovedByLight.speaker: Player
PAD_CurseRemovedByLight.text: That light - it's protecting me from the curse.

session_synopses.AD_Sign: Sign on the Risen Road before the Shadow Curse
session_synopses.Mountain: Players enter SCL for the first time through the mountain pass. They reflect upon having had a difficult journey. If a second party member is present, they'll point out that you're not alone.The camera then pans to show a group of Absolute cultists nearby, waiting for the drider to guide them.If Minthara has given you the mission to go to SCL the group will be a mix of half-orcs and goblins and the 2nd character will recognise them as the cultists you were looking for.If Minthara has NOT given you the mission to go to SCL the group will just be two goblins.
session_synopses.PAD_Curse_2Characters: Players are affected by the shadow curse. They start to lose health, and can feel the darkness starting to suck their life away - and 2 party members are available to AD about this.
session_synopses.PAD_CurseRemovedByLight: Curse is removed from player because they are close to a light.

AD_ShadowlandsComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_ShadowlandsComment.text: Darkness. Desolation. The Dark Lady's hand at work, mayhaps? HahaHA-HEE!
AD_ShadowlandsComment.context: NodeContext: Said with the laughing madness so common to the character.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowlandsComment: The spirit of the amulet comments on the state of the Shadowcurse and how it's effecting the land

Raven_AD_GoBack.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_GoBack.text: You found the ledger? Guess you're not so useless. Get back to master, on the double!

Raven.speaker: Player
Raven.text: You're a loathsome little bird, aren't you?

Raven.speaker: Raven
Raven.text: True. But people will miss me when I'm gone.
Raven.context: NodeContext: biting and vicious, she's incredibly cruel

Raven.speaker: Raven
Raven.text: No one will miss you when you die. They'll piss on your grave. Hah!
Raven.context: NodeContext: gearing up, delighting in ripping the player a new one. Maniacal laugh at the end

ShadarKai.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai.context: CinematicNodeContext: Using SWD on the corpse of a dwarf. NodeContext: Shadar-Kai speaks in a cold, calculated tone.

ShadarKai.speaker: Madeline
ShadarKai.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse CollapsesNodeContext: Speak with dead style

ShadarKai.speaker: He Who Was
ShadarKai.text: You walk in the darkness, unafraid? How curious.

session_synopses.Raven_AD_GoBack: A brief AD ment to remind the player to go back to shadar kai.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.Raven: You talk to a Raven in the shadow-cursed lands. Part of the Servant of the Raven booster.
session_synopses.ShadarKai: You talk to a shadar-kai from the shadowfell. He tasks you with collecting memories from the dead.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.

session_synopses.DeadHarper: The player uses Speak with Dead to talk to a dead Harper in the Shadowcursed Lands. The Harper was sent by Jaheira to find weaknesses in Ketheric's Defense. The Harper player should be able to earn some redundant information that can be learned elsewhere as well as some unique information to help them navigate Act 2

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: You should have just left me alone!

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: Spoil my fun? I'll teach you a lesson - just you watch.

AD_Hiding.speaker: Oliver
AD_Hiding.text: Come on, are you even looking?
AD_Hiding.context: NodeContext: teasing, giggly whispers during a game of hide and seek.

AD_Dome50PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome50PercentHP.text: You're spoiling my fun! Stop it right now, or you'll be sorry!
AD_Dome50PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player is attacking a magic dome shielding Oliver, reducing its integrity by 50%)

AD_AfterHideAndSeek.speaker: Oliver
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.text: You were good. But just you wait - I'll get better.
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: A little miffed at losing/considering ways to improve his hide & seek game

AD_Dome25PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome25PercentHP.text: Why are you doing this? All I wanted to do was play!
AD_Dome25PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player has reduced a magic dome shielding Oliver to 25% integrity)

session_synopses.AD_StartOfFight: AD from Oliver if players chase him to the TWN Center for the climax of Lifting the Curse
session_synopses.AD_Hiding: The first time Oliver hides he'll turn invisible and run away. As long as players are nearby the closest one will hear his voice inside his head (like how the emperor does) laughing at them for not being able to find him.
session_synopses.AD_Dome50PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 50%.
session_synopses.AD_AfterHideAndSeek: After playing with Oliver hide and seek for two times he will stay at his house. Depending on how the player did, he'll be left thinking about new ideas on how to improve his hide and seek abilities or happy because they didn't find him without alerting/killing the shadows.
session_synopses.AD_Dome25PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 25%.

ShadowMemory4.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

ShadowMemory9.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory27.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3.text: *Desperate prayers to Selûne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Selûne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory13.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory13.text: *You sense a young woman, gazing at Moonrise Towers in awe. Perhaps one day she will get to gaze out from atop it, she hopes.*

ShadowMemory29.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory29.text: *You see a mother sitting by her child's bedside, listening to his sickly breathing as he sleeps.*

ShadowMemory14.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory14.text: *The image of an orange-haired cat asleep before a fireplace comes to you. What came of it?*

ShadowMemory19.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory19.text: *Before the shadows, there was once a house full of warmth a childrens' laughter in this one's life. No more.*

ShadowMemory7.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory7.text: *You sense that this one was once a fisherman, taught by his father.*

ShadowMemory23.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory23.text: *As the pile of sawdust on the floor grows larger, the cabinet gradually takes shape. The carpenter's pride washes over you...*

Entrance_Plaque1.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque1.text: *We offer our prayers to the Dark Lady, whose comfort and grace heals all.*

session_synopses.ShadowMemory4: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.

session_synopses.Entrance_Plaque1: rounded clickable plaque in the exit/enrance to the Underdark right next to the Elevator

AD_Signpost.speaker: Narrator
AD_Signpost.text: *Last Light Inn, west. Moonrise Towers, southwest.*

session_synopses.AD_Signpost: AD on signpost in the shadow cursed lands. The road is twisted and broken, the sign is leaning at an odd angle, but you can still read that there's an inn to the north and Moonrise towers to the west.

Circle_PAD.speaker: Player
Circle_PAD.text: A ritual circle. Looks like it was used in the crafting of Moonlanterns.

session_synopses.Circle_PAD: Players have clicked on a hidden ritual circle on a desk in SCL.The second option triggers if Gale already knows how to use it.

PAD_DiscoverGrave.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverGrave.text: This grave is a mess - probably an animal's doing.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverGrave: Player finds the grave of Ellie May. It's been dug up with her bones scattered,

PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.text: Hells. The curse has torn open the ground itself...

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowlandDevastation: Party comments on just how destroyed the landscape is in parts of the Shadowcurse.Gale inparticular notes how the tectonic plates have even shifted.

VB_DirtpileGas.speaker: Player
VB_DirtpileGas.text: Argh! This air is foul with rot. Better be careful...

VB_Revitalized.speaker: Player
VB_Revitalized.text: That place is cursed; I feel better just for having left it.

PAD_ShadowheartResistant.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.text: I can feel the shadows' power here... but they don't seem to be harming me?
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.context: NodeContext: Some confusion. She seems to have resistance in a shadow-cursed environment  that's affecting all others.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

EmperorAD_CompanionCursed.text: Your ally is falling to the curse. Help them.

PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.text: The Dark Lady shields me - I can feel her.
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.context: NodeContext: Commenting on having divine protection from a shadow curse that affects all others

PAD_ShadowheartBlight.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlight.text: Even Lady Shar's blessings cannot protect me here.
PAD_ShadowheartBlight.context: NodeContext: Commenting on losing Shar's protection against a shadow curse (venturing into where its strongest)

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartResistant: Shadowheart comments on how she is resistant to the first layer of the curse.
session_synopses.PAD_LightsSnuffedOut: You're walking through an area where the shadow curse is strong and your torch gets snuffed out by the curse.
session_synopses.EmperorAD_CompanionCursed: Used exclusively when players have a companion left unattended/unhooked and without any protection against the curse. Goes hand in hand with a switch to turn based mode.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlessed: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection against the curse return.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlight: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection fade.

AD_HistoryCheck.speaker: Player
AD_HistoryCheck.text: Pickets, ballistas, siege engines... a little old-fashioned, too. A hundred years? More?

session_synopses.AD_HistoryCheck: Player comments on old siege equiment in SCL

AD_NightsongAttacked.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked.text: Unleash your wrath! It only fuels my fury.

AD_TauntPlayer.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer.text: What are you afraid of? Your own wicked heart?

session_synopses.AD_NightsongAttacked: Nightsong cries in pain as she gets attacked by the player.
session_synopses.AD_TauntPlayer: Nightsong tries to goad the player into killing her

PAD_Shadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Shadowheart.text: Through there... there's something about it. Need to look.

session_synopses.PAD_Shadowheart: Shadowheart has sudden, mysterious hunch and is compelled to investigate a side area in the Temple of Shar. (this is an unconscious prompt from somewhere in her memory - entering the side area will trigger a flashback scene from her past).

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: Countless initiates walked these halls once, seeking to become Dark Justiciars.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: I will follow in their path. I will succeed.

AD_LightTrialShadow.speaker: Shadow, Shadow
AD_LightTrialShadow.text: A true child of the Nightsinger embraces the shadows and passes unseen.

PAD_TeleportedByShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_TeleportedByShadow.text: Damn. That shade knocked me right back to the start.

PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning.text: Disappointing. Succeed or fail, the next attempt shall be the last.

PAD_DontHaveGem.speaker: Player
PAD_DontHaveGem.text: Don't have anything to put here.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiar: Shadowheart is walking along the corridors of the trials and is clearly excited about the prospect of finally proving herself worthy.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_TortureRoomPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_TeleportedByShadow: A player was seen by a ghost while attempting the sneaking trial in the Shar Temple and teleported back to the beginning of the trial.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning: Shar warns player that they only have one attempt left.
session_synopses.PAD_DontHaveGem: The player attempts to place a Sharran gem in the temple puzzle, but they do not have one.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The tangle of corpses gape at you lifelessly.*

Dead.speaker: Orthon's Bed
Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: processed voice with background sfx of a multitude wailing and moanin SwD has been cast on a pile of corpses forming the Orthon's bed.)NodeContext: Consumed with terror and agony.

session_synopses.Dead: Dialog used for casting the spell SwD on the Orthon's bed.Note that this bed is made up of numerous dead bodies when speaking, it should sound like there's a mass of souls wailing and moaning in the background as a primary corpse speaker delivers the lines.

AD_ScoutsRetreat.text: You tread where you are not wanted - leave.
AD_ScoutsRetreat.context: NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Warning off an exploring player
NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Alarm, supernaturally sensing danger (in the broader region of a large underground temple rather than right before them)

session_synopses.AD_ScoutsRetreat: The Tadpoled Skeleton Scouts spot the player and give them a brief warning before noticing the Shadowquake and running

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see Raphael casually leaning against a large tomb very near to the Thorm family catacombs entrance. When he sees us , he stands normally, smiles and greets us theatrically with a limerick.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see Raphael casually leaning against a large tomb very near to the Thorm family catacombs entrance. When he sees us , he stands normally, smiles and greets us theatrically with a limerick.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text:
Our hero thought but of treasure ahead,
Did not consider the peace of the dead...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text:
Through the dark they went creeping,
And awoke what was sleeping...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: A new grave they dug, which they themselves fed.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Ooh, spooky.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm (talking to Raphael)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How long have you been standing around practicing that little recital?

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Until it was perfect.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: I've grown quite fond of you, you know - in my way. I thought it only fair to warn you about the dangers ahead.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) When he says ‘the dangers ahead’ he gestures generally behind him, towards the entrance of the Thorm family catacombs.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: So you expect me to turn and walk away?

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Don't be absurd.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: It would be pointless of me to try to bar you from entering, but I can... set the scene as it were. Prepare you for your role.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine, paint me a picture.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: There is a stage down in the dark upon which a great drama has suspended itself in time.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Its actors dwell there still, mired in the languor of their long-tired scenes.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: If you, however, through the dark go creeping and awake what is sleeping...

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Chances are many more graves than yours alone will soon be fed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Enough of your jibber-jabber. Begone.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: As you wish.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: I'll be pleased to follow up on your little escapades in your camp one of these nights. Should you live to tell your tale, that is.

node_data.speaker: Raphael
node_data.text: Until then - adieu.

session_synopses: Raphael is encountered at the beginning of the Shar Temple. He briefs the player about the Orthon - the devil he mentions - either telling them that he personally wants it dead, or that it is between the player and their objective. He then saves them from a trap and warns them about the dangers of the temple, before vanishing.!!! Don't remove REALLY_ASTARION tag check from the OOM branch!!!

Sarcophagus2Plaque.speaker: Narrator
Sarcophagus2Plaque.text: *The reign of night comes in a thousand falling leaves.*
Sarcophagus2Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque in the temple of shadow.

session_synopses.Sarcophagus2Plaque: A sarcophagus plaque in Shar's temple.

PAD_Ambush.speaker: Player
PAD_Ambush.context: NodeContext: Urgent/just been ambushed by a cloaker (a big bat/manta ray-looking creature)

session_synopses.PAD_Ambush: The party reacts to being ambushed by a Cloaker in the Gauntlet of Shar

NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.speaker: Balthazar
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.text: A cheap attack, just as I'm finally reunited with my masterwork? This will not stand.
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.context: InternalNodeContext: Balthazar is hostile to the player as they attacked him before the normal scene flow triggered.NodeContext: Furious.

session_synopses.NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro: Balthazar responds to the player's attack before becoming hostile

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Can she possibly be Ketheric's daughter?

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Balthazar, a necromancer lap dog of Ketheric Thorm's.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Who knows what he may have up his rotten sleeve.

PAD_Mural_000.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_000.text: *Moonrise Towers. It makes the Urge hiss within. It was part of your disgrace, but how?*

PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.speaker: Player
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.text: Nothing - it must have been disarmed.
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.context: NodeContext: Stepped on a trap, but nothing happened

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.text: *Here lies Melodia Thorm, beloved wife and mother. Ai armiel telere maenen hir.*
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.context: NodeContext: Ah-less-ia /  Ay Army-el Teller-eh Man-en here

NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.InternalNodeContext: Occurs the first time the player uses the elevator/disc linking the Thorm mausoleum in SCL to the Shar Temple.
NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.

session_synopses.PAD_MyrkulSymbol: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.
session_synopses.PAD_MakeshiftVessel: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsMap: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque: PAD for characters reacting to finding Isobels plaque in the Ketheric Mausoleum. Has 3 reaction states:- Already know Ketheric is Isobel's Father- Don't know aboutfamily relationship but have met Isobel- Don't know about family relationship and haven't met Isobel
session_synopses.PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro: Party reacts to a magic-mouth skull that projects Balthazar's voice, warning them to leave.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_000: Player interacts with the first mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the first piece of the story. This mural depicts Moonrise Towers in its heyday, before it turned to darkness. The player's comment varies, depending on whether they've been to MRT or not.
session_synopses.PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate: Player steps with a pressure plate that should trigger the trap in the mausoleum but nothing happens.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsWifePlaque: Reaction from player/narrator who interacts with the tomb of Isobel's mother (and Ketheric's wife).
session_synopses.CINE_DescendingIntoTemple: Cinematic of players descending into the temple after jumping for the first time on the disc towards the temple.

AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer.speaker: Flesh
AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer.context: InternalNodeContext: The flesh golem has been summoned by the player to attack one of the golem's allies, and it isn't happy. SFX onlyNodeContext: Angry roar from a flesh golem.

AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.speaker: Player
AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.text: Not keen on fighting its allies. Should've figured.

session_synopses.AD_TurnsAgainstPlayer: Player summons flesh golem but the player's enemies are the golem's allies.
session_synopses.AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse: Player summons flesh golem but the player's enemies are the golem's allies. Player character comments on this to clarify this to the actual player

PAD_SpearLoot.speaker: Player
PAD_SpearLoot.text: This is no common spear... It must be the one that Shadowheart is supposed to find.

AD_SilencePlayer.context: NodeContext: Creepy ghost-whisper, spoken in combat.

session_synopses.PAD_SpearLoot: Voicebark when picking up the Spear of the Night. A sacred Sharran relic and vital for Shadowheart's quest to kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_SilencePlayer: Combat reaction for the Dark Justiciar ghosts in the Silent Library. When the player disturbs them they will silence the player . On the third disturbance they become hostile
session_synopses.AD_RiddlePlaque: Reads out the riddle on the plaque.

PAD_TriggeredShadows.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredShadows.text: So cold... there's something coming. I can feel it in the shadows...
PAD_TriggeredShadows.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers after the player is teleported into the corpse pit in the Shar Temple.NodeContext: Dread and unease.

session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredShadows: After being teleported into a pit filled with bones, the player notices shadows gathering around them as the air gets colder. The player should feel a sense of dread

PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognisedSharTemple.text: Some sort of temple? Looks abandoned.

session_synopses.PAD_RecognisedSharTemple: When the player first enters the Shar Temple they roll History to recognise it as the Gauntlet of Shar - an infamous training ground. If the player is Shadowheart, a Sharran, or a Selunite they automatically succeed

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves.text: You cannot harm me, but you can irritate me. Goodbye.
AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: mildly irritated, said right before he teleports away

session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the front of Shar Temple, in case he is attacked.

EntranceSharPlaque.speaker: Narrator
EntranceSharPlaque.text: *Shar. Singer of Eternal Night. Protector of the lost and forgotten.*
EntranceSharPlaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque inside the temple of shadow.

TrialsPlaque1.speaker: Narrator
TrialsPlaque1.text: *Brave the Gauntlet of Lady Shar. Test body, mind, and spirit with Her trials. Glory awaits the few who succeed.*

session_synopses.EntranceSharPlaque: The plaque below a painting of Shar covering burn victims with a dark shroud, shielding them from searing light.
session_synopses.HQ_Plaque1: This is the narrator AD played on a plaque in HQ center in Shar temple - a slightly secluded area that the player needs to spot and jump into. It is a big hall with control maps, and books, dedicated to HQ gatherings, linking to other Sharran temples and societies
session_synopses.TrialsPlaque1: This is a narrator AD on a long vertical plaque that contains a longer scripture. It is placed before the section of the temple that is dedicated to trials areas, so it can be a motivational guideline to what expects ahead.
session_synopses.NightsongPrison_Plaque1: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.

AD_TrialIntro.text: Nothing of value comes easy. Overcome my trials, and win my embrace.

AD_Baptism.text: The end draws near. You show great potential - do not falter now.
One more test awaits. Descend to the Nightsong. Make a sacrifice. Rise again a Dark Justiciar.

session_synopses.AD_TrialIntro: A disembodied voice speaks from a nearby statue. It tells the player that they have arrived at the trial area
session_synopses.AD_Baptism: A disembodied voice congratulates the player for reaching the entrance the inner sanctum of the Shar Temple. It urges the player too step into the water for their final test

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Keep your weapons sharp - our prey could reveal itself any time.

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Be ready, or I'll kill you myself.

session_synopses.AD_MerregonAndOrthon: The orthon occasionally speaks to one of his merregon footsoldiers after the trespass scene has ended. The orthon is fed up, irritable, The merregon is incapable of speech and provides only grunts, gasps and involuntary sounds.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Pained/dazed/contrite. Has just been made an outcast by her goddess and forcibly ejected from her realm.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.text: Shadowheart? What happened? You were missing for a moment.
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Alarmed. The companion vanished on teleporting out of a place, only to reappear in a confused, distress state.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartReturns: The party reacts to Shadowheart's delayed return from the Shadowfell - Shar held her back to punish her for not killing Nightsong.

AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.text: A dead githyanki. The corpse may hold something useful.

session_synopses.AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap: Laezel directs the player's attention to the dead body.

AD_HospitalComment.text: Ho ho, that unmistakable Sharran spirit. Ever so eager to stab, prod, and finger.

session_synopses.AD_HospitalComment: The spirit of the amulet comments on the shadow-cursed town's hospital, and the Sharran hospital stuff that aren't shy of torture and mutilation.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: A kiln, unfinished sculptures, stone fragments. Masons worked here.

session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Mason's Guild in SCL

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*North - Thorm Mausoleum
South - South Reithwin
East - Masons' Guild
West - House of Healing*

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: 'Rascal.'? 'Jagoda.'? All these collars belonged to pets.

session_synopses.PAD: Character interacts with a pile of pet collars.Different reaction depending on whether the user has read the missing pet posters before or not.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.text: IF YOU WILL NOT GIVE, THEN I WILL TAKE!

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.text: YOU BROUGHT VIOLENCE. UNACCEPTABLE. BUT ALL CAN BE FORGIVEN. FOR THE RIGHT PRICE.
TollhouseMaster.context: NodeContext: howling with anger on first phrases - more reasonable on last two phrases, hoping to get some cash out of the situation

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spotting you, Gerringothe lurches forward.NodeContext: a desperate, cacophonous howl

PAD_CormyrCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_CormyrCrate.text: Silks from Cormyr, it says. Empty, though.

AD_SafeSkeleton.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton.text: *A forgotten soul, trapped in a safe - but who put them there, and why?*

PAD_DalelandsCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_DalelandsCrate.text: Cheese from the Dalelands. Or what's left of it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They gave me what they had. Should I have let them leave?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: No. I thought there might be more to take. Hidden inside.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: I opened them. Searched inside them.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Why would you do something like that?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Some wouldn't pay their dues. Some couldn't.
Face_Guilt.context: NodeContext: Rising disgust with each sentence - but a twinge of malice with the last few words

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They paid a different price in the end.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Perhaps you'd feel less guilty if you paid for your crimes too.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Yes, yes. I have gold. So much gold. Take it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Take it all, whatever the cost.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.text: NO MORE TAKING. GIVE. GIVE. GIVE!

PAD_ThayCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_ThayCrate.text: All the way from Thay. Jewels and gems, probably - one's still in there.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: Crates and caravans. Must be where tolls were collected.

AD_Face_Heartlessness.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
AD_Face_Heartlessness.text: At least it's worth more than their lives.

PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.text: Well, we're not getting in this way.

PAD_BlockedDoor.speaker: Player
PAD_BlockedDoor.text: Forget it - it's blocked from behind.

Face_Greed.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed.text: Leave it. LEAVE IT. It's MINE.

PAD_TollmasterDead.speaker: Player
PAD_TollmasterDead.text: Free from the curse, now - perhaps she'll find peace.

session_synopses.TollhouseMaster: Dialogue with the Toll collector.She will continuously, endlessly demand gold from the player. You can convince her to let you pass (hard persuade), or you will have to fight  (once you stop giving it gold, or once you run out of gold).
session_synopses.AD_Face_Regret: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regreting about not leaving this town.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Regret, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_CormyrCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Cormyr.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseMaster: Tollhouse, Tollhouse Collector as she's hanging around by herself.
session_synopses.AD_SafeSkeleton: Player clicks on the skeleton that locked himself in the heavy safe in Tollhouse. This was am employee of Tollhouse and this way he hoped to wait out the fallout of Shadowcurse. But have died in that safe in dramatic way.
session_synopses.AD_Face_Cowardice: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_DalelandsCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Dalelands.
session_synopses.Face_Guilt: The Visage of Guilt, hovering in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).
session_synopses.AD_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque: Plaque in the Tollhouse, outside a room full of confiscated items.
session_synopses.PAD_ThayCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Thay.
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL
session_synopses.AD_Face_Heartlessness: The Visage of Heartlesness is standing near some shelves with goods and talks about taking stuff from other people.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflection. Heartlessnesst, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed: You've just clicked on a plaque beside a door in the Tollhouse, which tells you that room is for confiscated items. The way into the room is blocked by vegetation/fallen masonry (don't be specific).
session_synopses.PAD_BlockedDoor: PAD, happens when you click on a door in the tollhouse that is blocked from the other side.
session_synopses.Face_Greed: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of items it confiscated that became inaccessible once the shadows and vines moved in and blocked the room off.
session_synopses.PAD_TollmasterDead: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Tollmaster that went crazy about gold

Korrilla.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla.text: Tr-tread carefully. You are still... necessary.
Korrilla.context: NodeContext: the ellipses and hyphens here are to denote her struggling to get the words out as she's afflicted with shadowcurse

session_synopses.Korrilla: This is a fallback one-liner. In case the Player manages to approach her an initiate dialog in TWN, Korrilla gives a cryptic one-liner to the player. No Hasmet node is needed, as she teleports away right after.She would be struggling with the shadow curse as she says this line.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Missing - 'Zola'. 'Rascal'. Why do those names sounds familiar? Oh - the blood-stained collars...

session_synopses.PAD: Character interacts with a board of posters outlining many pets who have gone missing in the town in the shadowlands.

PAD.speaker: Astarion
PAD.text: Is that blood on the shelves? Probably cold and congealed - urgh.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Unpleasantly surprised to find a room of jars filled with blood

session_synopses.PAD: Astarion reacting on approaching Blood Bank.

PAD_GithRadarGoesOffComment.speaker: Player
PAD_GithRadarGoesOffComment.text: That noise - it's coming from the gith knight's trinket.

AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.text: W'wargaz failed to kill you. I won't make the same mistake!

session_synopses.PAD_GithRadarGoesOffComment: The Gith Radar starts making a sound and players comment on it.Branching depending on whether they allied with Voss and he told them what it does.Prioritizes playing on Laezel even if she's not the one carrying the radar but is nearby.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *The corpse is saturated with darkness, flesh and bone corrupted by a dense concentration of Shadow Weave. Sharran magic, summoned from beyond the Weave's boundaries. Beyond Mystra's control.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of dark shadow magic reflecting flashing over Gale's face. Gale reacts.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *Left alone, its corruption will leak and spread. You could nullify it, preventing such harm as Mystra would want. Or you could absorb it, tasting Shar's forbidden magic for yourself.*

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *Shadow magic floods your body. Where you once felt Mystra's light, there is now only darkness.*
LootBoss.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark VFX glows stronger. Gale smiles - happy to have the power.

LootBoss.speaker: Narrator
LootBoss.text: *Is this the Shadow Weave's presence, or a darkness within you from the beginning, waiting to be called?*

session_synopses.LootBoss: Gale (or someone near Gale) has attempted to loot a corpse and Gale realises the evil possibilities.

PAD_DoorSpotted.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorSpotted.text: Strange - the dust on the leftmost door has been wiped clean.

session_synopses.PAD_TrapSpotted: The player spots the trap in the aasimar survivor booster.
session_synopses.PAD_DoorSpotted: The player discovers a door to the hideout where an Aasimar Harper had survived longer than most would in the curse.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: A Selûne prayer book. Hmm, well she didn't answer any prayers from this place.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on picking up "Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she picks up the book or when another character does that.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: Rambling nonsense. Why someone would be drawn to this is beyond me.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on reading"Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she reads the book or when another character does that.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Hauliers and merchants wanted. Sail the silvery seas! Gaze upon the Gate! No experience required.*

session_synopses.AD: "Help Wanted" poster in the Cursed Town.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Reithwin House of Healing. Presiding Surgeon: Malus Thorm.*

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Quite the list of characters, but hardly my taste.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Just read a list of people who gave their blood to a hospital. Farmers and vagabonds - he's not impressed.

session_synopses.PAD: Astarion reacting on picking up / reading "Blood Bank Inventory List" by any player (including himself)Location: SCL -> Hospital -> Morgue

PAD_ArmyLeft.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmyLeft.text: The Absolute's armies are on the march - and Baldur's Gate is their target.

session_synopses.PAD_ArmyLeft: Comment on how the absolute army left. Reactivity if you saw them previously or not.

PAD_Arrested.speaker: Player
PAD_Arrested.text: Well. This is quite the mess you've gotten us into.
PAD_Arrested.context: InternalNodeContext: If the first char chose to procceed in TWN_MarchingArmy_Arrest then here the second char makes a sarcastic comments about it (like, "you really thought they wouldn't catch us")

session_synopses.PAD_Arrested: The dialog after we got arrested and thrown in Moonrise Prison / Corpse Pit. The companion (if present) is sarcastic about our previous statement (before being captured) where we said that we would be able to sneak past the army without any issues.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.context: NodeContext: RYTH-win. Like rye bread, not wreath. TH like in 'thick', not like in 'those'.
